content.title: Roos (EAST) Test
content.description: Elevated Arm Stress Test - provocative maneuver considered most sensitive for neurogenic thoracic outlet syndrome.

technique.position: Arms abducted to 90°, elbows flexed 90°, shoulders externally rotated
technique.maneuver: Patient opens and closes fists for 3 minutes
technique.observation: Note symptom reproduction and ability to complete test

interpretation.positive: Cannot complete 3 minutes, reproduction of neurogenic symptoms

clinical_utility.sensitivity: Higher than Adson or Wright tests for neurogenic TOS
clinical_utility.specificity: Relatively specific when symptom reproduction occurs

content.clinical_pearl: Most reliable of the provocative tests; inability to complete with symptom reproduction strongly suggests nTOS
